sentence.Network_en: He accused President Carter of vacillation and retreat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指责卡特总统的动摇和退缩。

sentence.Network_en: Vacillation is the cause of his failure.
sentence.Network_cn: 优柔寡断是他失败的原因.

sentence.Network_en: His constant vacillation made him an unfit administrator.
sentence.Network_cn: 他经常优柔寡断,这使他不适合当行政官员.

entry.tran: 犹豫不定;踌躇;拿不定主意
entry.def: If you vacillate between two alternatives or choices, you keep changing your mind.

example.ex: She vacillates between men twice her age and men younger than she...
example.tran: 她犹豫不决，不知道是该选择年龄比她大一倍的男人还是比她小的男人。

example.ex: We cannot vacillate on the question of the party's leadership.
example.tran: 在党的领导权问题上我们不能动摇。

means.word_mean: 2. changing location by moving back and forth

sentences.en: to oppose all vacillation and compromise
